item.title: CISA director Jen Easterly to depart agency on January 20
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description:
CISA's director will depart the agency after three years at the helm, as part of the "seamless transition" of government power.

item.title: Mistral unveils new AI models and chat features
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
French AI startup Mistral has released a slew of updates to its product portfolio as it looks to stay competitive in the cutthroat AI space. Mistral’s Le Chat chatbot platform can now search the web — with citations in line, a la OpenAI’s ChatGPT. It’s also gained a “canvas” tool along the lines of ChatGPT […]

item.title: India orders Meta to curb WhatsApp data sharing, levies $25M fine
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
India’s competition watchdog has ordered WhatsApp to stop sharing user data with other Meta units for advertising purposes for five years and also levied a fine of $25.4 million for antitrust violations related to WhatsApp’s controversial 2021 privacy policy. The Competition Commission of India, which began the investigation in 2021, found that WhatsApp’s “take-it-or-leave-it” privacy […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Twenty is building an open source alternative to Salesforce
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
If a software product is successful enough, you’ll probably be able to find a company building an open source alternative. And yet, nobody has created a modern open source CRM product that can be considered as a serious competitor to Salesforce. That’s exactly what Twenty is trying to achieve. For the past couple of years, […]

item.title: AI training software firm iLearningEngines says it lost $250,000 in recent cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
The US-based firm said hackers misdirected a $250,000 wire transfer payment that it hasn't been able to recover.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Beyoncé to perform live on Netflix during NFL Christmas Gameday stream
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
Beyoncé is headed to Netflix. The singer will perform live during the halftime show during the Houston Texans vs. Baltimore Ravens Christmas Day game, which is set to be streamed on the as part of its newly minuted three-year deal with the NFL.  “Your early Christmas wish has been granted as Beyoncé will perform during Netflix’s […]

item.title: Meta brings certain AI features to Ray-Ban Meta glasses in Europe
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
After a brief delay, Meta says that it’s begun to roll out certain AI features to users of its Ray-Ban Meta AR glasses in France, Italy, and Spain. Starting today, people in those countries can invoke Meta’s AI assistant, Meta AI, using their voice to get answers to general questions (e.g. “What are some good […]

item.title: SuperAnnotate helps companies manage their AI data sets
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
SuperAnnotate, a platform for managing and prepping AI training data sets, has raised a new round of capital.

item.title: Space tech giant Maxar confirms hacker accessed employees’ personal data
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
Maxar has 2,600 employees — with more than half having security clearances to work on classified U.S. government projects.

item.title: Moonvalley wants to build more ethical video models
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Moonvalley, a new generative video startup, claims it's building models using more ethical and transparent approaches.

item.title: Xiaomi taps PhonePe’s app store for India smartphones
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Xiaomi will replace its app store with fintech PhonePe’s offering for customers in India starting January. The move is a major win for the Indian startup, as well as a sign of further recalibration for the Chinese hardware giant in one of its biggest markets outside its home country. Xiaomi, the second largest smartphone vendor […]

item.title: Text marketing firm Blip secures backing from SoftBank, Microsoft
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Take Blip, a conversational marketing platform, has raised $60 million in funding from SoftBank and Microsoft.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Roblox no longer allows users under 13 to message others outside of games
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Roblox will not let users under the age of 13 message others outside of games and experiences on the platform, the company said Friday. Roblox also announced a series of other built-in protections for young users, such as age-gating certain experiences, along with enhanced parental controls.  Roblox has been criticized for failing to protect children […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: MakeMyTrip buys Happay from CRED
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Indian travel and hospitality aggregator MakeMyTrip has agreed to acquire expense management platform Happay from fintech CRED. The deal, announced on Monday, will see Happay’s expense management business and team transition to MakeMyTrip, while the payments division will remain at CRED. The financial terms were not disclosed and couldn’t be immediately learned. CRED, which had […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Juna.ai wants to use AI agents to make factories more energy-efficient
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Juna.ai wants to help factories become more efficient by automating complex industrial processes using AI agents.

item.title: India’s HealthKart valued at $500M in new investment
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Indian nutrition startup HealthKart’s valuation has surged to about $500 million in a new all-secondary investment of $153 million, two sources familiar with the matter told TechCrunch. The investment, one of the largest for an Indian consumer startup this year, was co-led by private equity firms ChrysCapital and Motilal Oswal, with Avendus Capital serving as […]

item.title: Oyo founder seeks new investment at $3.8B valuation
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
An investment vehicle backed by Oyo’s founder, Ritesh Agarwal, has proposed to inject another $65.1 million into the Indian hospitality startup, according to notices to shareholders that were reviewed by TechCrunch. The investment, through Redsprig Innovation Partners, would value the SoftBank-backed company at $3.8 billion, according to terms shared in a notice to shareholders. While […]

item.title: World of Warcraft turns 20
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Blizzard Entertainment first released World of Warcraft in November 2004, so The New York Times celebrated the anniversary by outlining the many ways we can still see the massively multiplayer online roleplaying game’s influence’s 20 years later. For one thing, while multiplayer games and early social networks such as MySpace already existed, WoW provided a […]

item.title: What is Bluesky when it’s not the underdog?
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Bluesky is having a moment — a moment that’s already stretched on for nearly three months. Over the summer, the social media app saw a wave of new signups in Brazil after X (formerly Twitter) was temporarily banned there. And in the United States, unhappiness with changes at X, and with owner Elon Musk’s close […]

item.title: The Exploration Company raises $160M to build Europe’s answer to SpaceX Dragon
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Only two companies currently provide cargo delivery to and from the International Space Station, and both are based in the United States. The Exploration Company, which operates out of Germany, France, and Italy, is looking to change that: It just closed a large funding round to further its mission of building Europe’s first reusable space […]
